question: How could systematic desensitisation be helpful to someone overcoming a phobia of birds? Why might this be more ethical than using flooding (6 marks):
answer: The answer should refer to at least six of the following points - The individual would be taught relaxation techniques, they could help devise a hierarchy reflecting the least to most feared situation, the person would be exposed to birds through the stages of the hierarchy (gradually), example of a low-fear situation (a photo), example of a high-fear situation (touching a bird), systematic desensitisation is a very gradual process in comparison to flooding which may be traumatic for young children

question: Outline and evaluate the following definitions of abnormality; statistical infrequency and failure to function adequately (8 marks):
answer: The answer should refer to at least eight of the following points - statistical infrequency is behaviour which is uncommon in society, failure to function adequately is behaviour which causes a person distress and an inability to cope with everyday life, Rosenhan and Seligman suggested five attributes which abnormal people may possess (unpredictability, maladaptiveness,, irrationality, observer discomfort and personal suffering), statistical infrequency fails to account for behaviour which is uncommon but desirable such as high IQ, FFA holds an incomplete definitions as some behaviours such as smoking are maladaptive but is not a sign of abnormality, FFA criteria holds real-world importance as the attributes can be used as goals for treatment
